post.title: So this what blogging feels like
post.author: henners
post.content:
I've finally got around to starting my tech blog. I feel like I should have been doing this years ago, for a couple of reasons:

1. Forgetfulness - When I solve a problem then inevitably come across the same thing months later I would rather look it up here than go through the process of working it out again.

2. Sharing - If I solve a problem that's not well documented, I should share it. After all, Your Blog is The Engine of Community.

My main criteria for picking a blogging platform was simplicity but I also wanted something I could host and tinker about with. I remembered hearing about MiniBlog by Mads Kristensen a while ago that seems like a good fit. To get the blog up and running in Azure I've made a few customisations which I will write about soon.
